title: ARM64 Linux acceptance tests unsupported - need x86_64
description:
## Summary
ARM64 Linux (e.g., devcontainer on Apple Silicon Mac) cannot run acceptance tests because the game's native libraries crash.

## Technical Details
- libGDX ARM64 natives from Maven Central partially work (loads but crashes in gdx2d_set_blend)
- LWJGL 2.x ARM64 natives have display mode issues (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in getAvailableDisplayModes)
- OpenAL requires null ALSA config (no sound card in container) but still has issues
- Even with all workarounds, native crashes occur in libgdx.so

## Error Evidence
```
SIGSEGV at pc=..., pid=..., tid=...
C  [libgdx.so+0x14568]  gdx2d_set_blend+0x0
```

## Workarounds Attempted
1. Downloaded ARM64 libGDX natives from Maven
2. Installed system LWJGL ARM64 packages
3. Configured null ALSA backend for OpenAL
4. Set LD_LIBRARY_PATH and java.library.path

## Resolution Options
1. Run acceptance tests on x86_64 Linux (GitHub Actions)
2. Run on macOS with native Steam installation
3. Wait for better ARM64 support from game dependencies

## Current Script Behavior
run-acceptance-tests.sh now exits early on ARM64 Linux with clear error message.

title: Loadout versioning and edit-in-place
description:
Allow editing loadouts in place while maintaining accurate historical statistics.

Requirements:
1. Snapshot deck/relics in arena_runs table at fight time (not just loadout_id reference)
2. Compute content hash of loadout config (deck + relics + potions)
3. Store content_hash in arena_runs when fight starts
4. Store content_hash in loadouts table (updated on any change)
5. In stats/history views, indicate when a fight was done with an older version:
   - Show indicator like "(old version)" or different color
   - Allow filtering to show only fights with current version
6. Add "Edit" button to loadout selection that opens creator with existing config
7. Editing updates the loadout and its content_hash
8. Consider showing: "3 encounters only tested on older versions"

Alternative simpler approach:
- Just snapshot deck_json/relics_json in arena_runs
- Compare current loadout to snapshot to detect differences
- Skip complex versioning, just show "loadout changed since this fight"
close_reason: Implemented loadout versioning: content hash computation, snapshot storage in arena_runs, edit button in loadout screen, and edit mode in creator screen
